sense.name: restart or continue an activity after an interruption or pause
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] RESUME NP2[patient] (ADVP[temporal]) NP1[agent] RESUME NP2[predicate] (ADVP[temporal]) NP1[predicate] RESUME
sense.examples: John resumed speaking after taking a sip of water. They will resume bus service tomorrow. The bombing has resumed after three days of cease-fire. Negotiations with the union will resume tomorrow.

sense.name: return to or recover a previous state or attribute
sense.examples: The judge resumed his seat and called the court to order. The old candelabra has resumed its luster after I polished it. The king resumed the throne after four years in exile.

sense.name: summarize
sense.examples: The lawyer resumed the issues for the court in his final statement. Shall I resume what happened during our last meeting before we begin today?
